description: Great app, especially if you don't like being tracked and traced.
summary: Great app, does what it's supposed to

description:
Coredumps... here's the error, even after re-installing QT and canberra.

(WickrPro:15308): Gtk-WARNING **: 16:13:56.152: Theme parsing error: gtk.css:1566:23: 'font-feature-settings' is not a valid property name

(WickrPro:15308): Gtk-WARNING **: 16:13:56.157: Theme parsing error: gtk.css:3616:25: 'font-feature-settings' is not a valid property name

(WickrPro:15308): Gtk-WARNING **: 16:13:56.158: Theme parsing error: gtk.css:4078:23: 'font-feature-settings' is not a valid property name
Gtk-Message: 16:13:56.227: Failed to load module "canberra-gtk-module"
Gtk-Message: 16:13:56.227: Failed to load module "canberra-gtk-module"
[0325/161356.301202:WARNING:resource_bundle_qt.cpp(116)] locale_file_path.empty() for locale 
Qt WebEngine ICU data not found at /opt/qt512/resources. Trying parent directory...
Qt WebEngine ICU data not found at /opt/qt512. Trying application directory...
Installed Qt WebEngine locales directory not found at location /opt/qt512/translations/qtwebengine_locales. Trying application directory...
Qt WebEngine locales directory not found at location /snap/wickrpro/548/usr/bin/qtwebengine_locales. Trying fallback directory... Translations MAY NOT not be correct.
Path override failed for key ui::DIR_LOCALES and path '/home/user/snap/wickrpro/548/.QtWebEngineProcess'
Qt WebEngine resources not found at /opt/qt512/resources. Trying parent directory...
Qt WebEngine resources not found at /opt/qt512. Trying application directory...
[0325/161356.331612:WARNING:resource_bundle_qt.cpp(116)] locale_file_path.empty() for locale 
Illegal instruction (core dumped)
Not sure what changed, but things appear to be working great again. Hooray!

On Kubuntu 20.04, the main version does not work. Use the candidate version instead:
sudo snap install wickrpro --channel=candidate
summary: 5.77.13 is broken. Use candidate version instead
